maml:description.maml:para: Get a stream.

Gets all streams or returns a specific stream by its ID. If retrieving a specific stream, you can optionally specify its version. Without specifying it, the latest version is returned by default. When listing all streams, you can filter the results by group ID or property name.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
Your group's ID.
Defines the stream's log type: CDN, EdgeWorkers, Edge DNS or Global Traffic Management logs. For details, see Log types (ref:log-types).
Filters down streams for a specific property, also referred to as an object . Allows up to five comma-delimited property names to specify a larger subset.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Your stream's version. If omitted, the operation returns the latest stream version.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.

The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

Your stream's ID.
Your stream's version. If omitted, the operation returns the latest stream version.

Get data set fields.

Gets the list of available data set fields that you can choose to monitor in your logs for a stream configuration. To get the data sets available for a specific product, you need to specify the product ID.
Defines the stream's log type: CDN, EdgeWorkers, Edge DNS or Global Traffic Management logs. For details, see Log types (ref:log-types).
The product's ID. It allows listing data sets available for that product.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

List Edge DNS zones by contract
Returns Edge DNS zones on your contract. Run this operation to get the `zoneName` values you need to or .

View history.

Gets details about all versions of a given stream. It helps you track changes between the versions of the stream, including monitored properties, logged data set fields, and log delivery destinations. Optionally, specify the values for both the `-StartVersion` and `-EndVersion` parameters to get details on all stream versions for a given range.
Defines the stream's log type: CDN, EdgeWorkers, Edge DNS or Global Traffic Management logs. For details, see Log types (ref:log-types).
Your stream's ID.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
Defines the stream's log type: CDN, EdgeWorkers, Edge DNS or Global Traffic Management logs. For details, see Log types (ref:log-types).
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Your stream's ID.
View upload metrics.
Gets aggregated metrics for log file uploads, including success or failure upload counts, upload latency, and the volume of data uploaded in the stream.
To get metrics from a specific time range, set the `-Start` and `-End` dates. To get the group data by time intervals, set the `-AggregationInterval` parameter.
Your stream's ID.
Specifies the beginning of the time range for the metrics in ISO 8601 format. Set this no more than seven days before the `end` date.
Specifies the end of the time range for the metrics in ISO 8601 format. Set this no more than seven days after the `start` date.
Your group's ID.
Specifies the time interval for metrics aggregation, either 5 minutes, an hour, or 24 hours. If omitted, this operation returns the metrics grouped in hourly intervals.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Retrieve detailed metrics. If absent, this operation returns only the `timestamp`, `streamId`, `successAttemptResponseCount`, and `failAttemptResponseCount` values.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Specifies the time interval for metrics aggregation, either 5 minutes, an hour, or 24 hours. If omitted, this operation returns the metrics grouped in hourly intervals.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
Specifies the end of the time range for the metrics in ISO 8601 format. Set this no more than seven days after the `start` date.
Your group's ID.
Retrieve detailed metrics. If absent, this operation returns only the `timestamp`, `streamId`, `successAttemptResponseCount`, and `failAttemptResponseCount` values.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Specifies the beginning of the time range for the metrics in ISO 8601 format. Set this no more than seven days before the `end` date.
Your stream's ID.
Get properties by group.

Gets properties that are active on the production and staging network and available within a specific group. Run this operation to get and store the `-PropertyID` values and use them in the `New-DataStream` and `Set-DataStream` operations.
Your group's ID.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
Your group's ID.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Create a stream.

Creates a stream configuration. Within a stream configuration, you can select properties to monitor in the stream, data set fields to collect in logs, and a destination to send these log files to. Apart from the log and delivery frequency configurations, you can decide whether to activate the stream on making the request or later using the `-Activate` switch parameter.
> Note: Only active streams can collect and send logs to their destinations.
Defines the stream's log type: CDN, EdgeWorkers, Edge DNS or Global Traffic Management logs. For details, see Log types (ref:log-types).
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or a string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Add this switch to activate the stream at the time of the request. When you edit a stream that is active, you need to disable this switch.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Add this switch to activate the stream at the time of the request. When you edit a stream that is active, you need to disable this switch.
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or a string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
Defines the stream's log type: CDN, EdgeWorkers, Edge DNS or Global Traffic Management logs. For details, see Log types (ref:log-types).
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Activate a stream.

Activates the latest version of a stream. Activating a stream takes approximately an hour. Once a stream is active, and the `DataStream` behavior is enabled in Property Manager, it starts collecting data and sending log files to a destination.
To stop receiving the logs, you can deactivate the stream at any time. See the `New-DataStreamDeactivation` operation for details.
Defines the stream's log type: CDN, EdgeWorkers, Edge DNS or Global Traffic Management logs. For details, see Log types (ref:log-types).
Your stream's ID.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
Defines the stream's log type: CDN, EdgeWorkers, Edge DNS or Global Traffic Management logs. For details, see Log types (ref:log-types).
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Your stream's ID.
Deactivate a stream.

Deactivates the latest version of a stream. Deactivating a stream means that, in approximately an hour, you stop receiving logs for the properties that this stream monitors and the stream's status changes to `DEACTIVATED`.
To start receiving log files again, you can activate the stream at any time using the `New-DataStreamActivation` operation.
Defines the stream's log type: CDN, EdgeWorkers, Edge DNS or Global Traffic Management logs. For details, see Log types (ref:log-types).
Your stream's ID.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
Defines the stream's log type: CDN, EdgeWorkers, Edge DNS or Global Traffic Management logs. For details, see Log types (ref:log-types).
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Your stream's ID.
Delete a stream.
Deletes a deactivated stream. Deleting a stream means that you can't activate this stream again and you stop receiving logs for the properties that this stream monitors.
Make sure to deactivate a stream first before deleting it. See the `New-DataStreamDeactivation` operation for details.
Defines the stream's log type: CDN, EdgeWorkers, Edge DNS or Global Traffic Management logs. For details, see Log types (ref:log-types).
Your stream's ID.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
Defines the stream's log type: CDN, EdgeWorkers, Edge DNS or Global Traffic Management logs. For details, see Log types (ref:log-types).
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Your stream's ID.
Edit a stream.

Updates the latest version of a stream. Running this operation creates a version of the stream that replaces the existing one. Note that only active streams can collect and send logs to their destinations.
You need to add the `-Activate` switch parameter when patching active streams, and optionally for inactive streams if you want to activate them upon request.
Defines the stream's log type: CDN, EdgeWorkers, Edge DNS or Global Traffic Management logs. For details, see Log types (ref:log-types).
Your stream's ID.
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or a string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Add this switch to activate the stream at the time of the request. When you edit a stream that is active, you need to disable this switch.

An account credential key that lets you move between accounts when using an API client enabled for multiple accounts. To find account switch keys, use Get-AccountSwitchKey (https://techdocs.akamai.com/powershell/docs/get-accountswitchkey).
Add this switch to activate the stream at the time of the request. When you edit a stream that is active, you need to disable this switch.
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or a string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.
Defines the stream's log type: CDN, EdgeWorkers, Edge DNS or Global Traffic Management logs. For details, see Log types (ref:log-types).
The section name in your EdgeGrid resource file to retrieve authentication credentials from. Defaults to `default`.
Your stream's ID.
Update specific aspects of a stream.

Updates selected details of an existing stream using JSON Patch syntax. Running this operation creates a stream version that replaces the current one. Currently, you can patch a stream using only the `REPLACE` operation.

When updating configuration objects, such as `destination` or `deliveryConfiguration`, pass the complete object. Thanks to this, you can avoid overwriting current details with the default values for omitted parameters, such as `tags`, `uploadFilePrefix`, and `uploadFileSuffix`.
Note that only active streams can collect and send logs to their destinations.
You need to add the `-Activate` switch parameter when patching active streams, and optionally for inactive streams if you want to activate them upon request.
Defines the stream's log type: CDN, EdgeWorkers, Edge DNS or Global Traffic Management logs. For details, see Log types (ref:log-types).
Your stream's ID.
A request body, either as a `PSCustomObject` or a string. This parameter supports pipelining.
Your EdgeGrid resource file to authenticate your command. Defaults to `~/.edgerc`.

Add this switch to activate the stream at the time of the request. When you edit a stream that is active, you need to disable this switch.

Add this switch to activate the stream at the time of the request. When you edit a stream that is active, you need to disable this switch.
